importantArticles.headline: The semiconductor sector is growing rapidly thanks to the rise of artificial intelligence (AI), making it a great area to invest in.  The industry saw 19% year-over-year revenue growth to $627 billion in 2024, and is forecast to hit $981 billion by 2029.  Two giants of the industry to consider investing in are Intel (NASDAQ: INTC) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA).
importantArticles.title: Better Semiconductor Stock: Intel vs. Nvidia

importantArticles.headline: We recently published a list of 10 Best Stocks to Buy According to Billionaire Chris Rokos. In this article, we are going to take a look at where NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) stands against other best stocks to buy according to billionaire Chris Rokos. Chris Rokos is a highly respected British hedge fund manager who co-founded […]
importantArticles.title: Is NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) the Best Stock to Buy According to Billionaire Chris Rokos?

importantArticles.headline: Catalysts host Madison Mills and Threadneedle Ventures founder Ann Berry go over some of Monday's top trending tickers. Nvidia (NVDA) is in focus as its CEO, Jensen Huang, met with Japan's prime minister to discuss energy needs for artificial intelligence (AI). Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management took a 20% stake in Hertz (HTZ), citing optimism in the company's turnaround strategy. Strategy (MSTR) received a Buy rating from CTBC Securities due to its (BTC-USD) bitcoin acquisition strategy, purchasing $555 million in bitcoin in the past week. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.
importantArticles.title: Nvidia & Japan, Hertz, Strategy & bitcoin: Trending Tickers

importantArticles.headline: Nvidia  stock fell again early Monday as the company remained in the crossfire of escalating U.S.-China trade tensions, even as CEO Jensen Huang did his part to try to mitigate the negative impacts of a trade war.  Nvidia stock has fallen 5.4% to $96.02 Monday while the  has dropped 2.3%, the  has delclined 1.9%, and the  is off 1.9%.  On Monday, Huang met Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba, following a meeting with Chinese leaders in Beijing on Thursday.
importantArticles.title: Nvidia Stock Falls. How CEO Jensen Huang Is Trying to Ease Trade War Fears.

importantArticles.headline: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) just became the latest company to get hit by the trade war.  On Wednesday, the stock tumbled after it announced that it would take a charge of up to $5.5 billion in the first quarter due to a new restriction on exports of its H20 chips to China.  The U.S. has pressured a number of other companies to restrict high-tech exports to China, including EUV lithography machine maker ASML.
importantArticles.title: Nvidia Just Lost a $5.5 Billion Opportunity. This Fast-Growing Tech Stock Could Scoop It Up

importantArticles.headline: U.S. stocks dropped sharply Monday, continuing a volatile stretch for Wall Street as geopolitical tensions, earnings anxiety, and Federal Reserve uncertainty continue to collide.
importantArticles.title: The Dow plunges 1,000 points and the Nasdaq reels as Trump attacks Powell again

importantArticles.headline: Most investors came to know Super Micro as one of the biggest artificial intelligence winners, at least through the first half of last year.  Despite all of this, Super Micro has actually refuted a lot of the allegations against it, and it's also very well positioned to capture the next wave of AI investment.  First, the best news for Super Micro is that its new auditor appears to have cleared its books as accurate, despite the resignation of former auditor Ernst & Young last October.
importantArticles.title: Prediction: Super Micro Computer Could Surge by 150% in the Next Year

importantArticles.headline: The "Magnificent Seven" is a name given to Apple, Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), Nvidia, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla because of their impact on the market over the past few years.  Unfortunately, the "Magnificent Seven" hasn't been so magnificent in recent weeks, with all seven down year to date.  Having the Magnificent Seven stocks slump isn't ideal because they account for a lot of many major indexes (especially the S&P 500), but it does present investors with a good opportunity to buy great companies at a "discounted" price.
importantArticles.title: 1 "Magnificent Seven" Stock You'll Regret Not Buying During the Dip

importantArticles.headline: Shares of Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), the leading maker of artificial intelligence (AI) chips, dropped 8.5% last week, which was a four-day trading week due to the stock market being closed for the Good Friday holiday.  Nvidia stock ended the week priced at $101.49 per share.  For additional context, shares of Nvidia competitor Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) were down 6.3%.
importantArticles.title: Nvidia Stock: The Week of April 14-18 in Review

importantArticles.headline: Investors have been left scratching their heads after President Trump announced global tariffs on April 2, then put the "reciprocal" tariffs with most of the world on pause for 90 days, stepped up a trade war with China, and has since flip-flopped on duties on tariffs on electronics while saying he may pull back tariffs on autos.  While investors may be nervous about the trade war and the increasing risk of a recession, long-term investors know that sell-offs represent buying opportunities as quality businesses just got cheaper.  Investors can't run away from Target (NYSE: TGT) fast enough, it seems.
importantArticles.title: Stock Market Sell-Off: 2 Stocks That Could Double in 2 Years

importantArticles.headline: Shaken by geopolitical shocks, the S&P 500 was flat last week and the Nasdaq nosed just into the red — but the Dow Jones Industrial Average finished significantly lower, weighed down by a double blow from UnitedHealth (UNH) and Nvidia (NVDA).
importantArticles.title: Google, Tesla, and IBM earnings lead a make-or-break week for stocks

importantArticles.headline: As the US and China continue their faceoff, companies are caught in the crossfire.
importantArticles.title: Popular AI app faces US ban (just like TikTok)
